body:
You are right, listing bandwidth is not accounted for by bwlimit.

I'd need to put the limit in at a lower level, in the http transport. This wouldn't affect SFTP but it would catch most of the backends.

I would have thought your tpslimit would work reasonable well but I guess it doesn't ?

Well, even with uber-limiting switches ( `--tpslimit 1 --transfers 1 --checkers=1 --bwlimit 512b` ), the problem is very much present... 

I can tell whenever my sync script (running in background once per hour) is listing files on remotes, because all web browsing stops for 10 to 30 seconds, for me and everyone connected to the access point, and pinging a dns server (google's 8.8.8.8, always running in the background) reports reply times up to 3-4000ms.
Then (ironically), the "real" file upload starts and lagging stops (because of the `bwlimit` that i imposed, obviously).

So yeah, if it would be possible to move the limit to the http transport level, that would be absolutely wonderful.

---

ps: I know that the bigger problem upstream is the poor quality of (my) internet connection, but unluckily there's no better alternative where i live. And this might be true for many others current and future users.
I am limited in using rclone by this uncontrollable factor, and it's a shame because it's such a nice software
I'm due to be looking at the bandwidth limiting this dev cycle so I'll try to take a look then. Unless you want to help?
Sorry, i currently don't have the knowledge necessary to even know where to look

> Sorry, i currently don't have the knowledge necessary to even know where to look

No problems! I'll try to fit this in into the 1.53 dev cycle :crossed_fingers:

I've had a go at this - can you try it out please?

[v1.52.2-198-g6a399560-fix-4395-list-bwlimit-beta](https://beta.rclone.org/branch/v1.52.2-198-g6a399560-fix-4395-list-bwlimit-beta/) on branch [fix-4395-list-bwlimit](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/fix-4395-list-bwlimit) (uploaded in 15-30 mins)
Hi, i'm on windows and i don't see a windows build. Is it correct? Should i clone it from the repo and build it, instead?

Oops, sorry, broke the build. Try this one

[v1.52.2-198-gaedc8623-fix-4395-list-bwlimit-beta](https://beta.rclone.org/branch/v1.52.2-198-gaedc8623-fix-4395-list-bwlimit-beta/) on branch [fix-4395-list-bwlimit](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/fix-4395-list-bwlimit) (uploaded in 15-30 mins)
@aetonsi did that build work for you?

@ncw hello, sorry for late reply, it seems to work.
I used `--dry-run` to test the file listing only. 

- with ` --bwlimit 512b` (which is my usual value), file listing did not impact my connection and took around 1 minute
- without the bwlimit, file listing impacted my connection negatively and took around 20 seconds less, for the same files

So i'd say it works.
Tell me if you need any other testing done.

Thanks!

That is great thank you!

I'm not going to merge this just yet as I want to combine it with the other work on setting independent upload and download limits

Hopefully it will be in 1.53

Here is the next iteration of this

[v1.54.0-beta.4959.d7c84b094.fix-4395-list-bwlimit](https://beta.rclone.org/branch/fix-4395-list-bwlimit/v1.54.0-beta.4959.d7c84b094.fix-4395-list-bwlimit/) on branch [fix-4395-list-bwlimit](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/fix-4395-list-bwlimit) (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

Whenever you write a bandwidth `--bwlimit 100k` you can now write a pair `--bwlimit 10M:1M` which is upload:download.
